title: Why People Speed in Slow Zones
summary: This article explains why many drivers break 20mph speed limits. The author got a ticket for speeding in London and took a speed awareness course. They learned that most people were caught driving around 26mph, which is not very fast but still breaks the rule. Many find it hard to drive at 20mph because it feels too slow. Lots of tickets are given for this. Places like Wales and London are making more roads 20mph to keep people safe. Some people argue about this change. The article says it's complicated because of habits and how our brains work. We need to get used to slower speeds for safety.

background_read: Road safety is important to protect everyone, including drivers, cyclists, and pedestrians. Speed limits like 20mph are set in cities to reduce accidents and save lives. Learning about these rules helps drivers understand why they need to slow down and how it can make communities safer for all.
Article_Structure: WHO: The author and other drivers who got speeding tickets.
WHAT: Speeding in 20mph zones and attending a speed awareness course.
WHERE: In urban areas like London and Wales.
WHY: To discuss why it's hard to follow 20mph limits and to promote safety.

perspectives.description: Some people think 20mph limits are good because they keep roads safe and prevent accidents.
Others argue that 20mph limits are too slow and make driving frustrating for motorists.
